name: Kognity
description:
The single factor that has the highest impact on the prosperity and well-being of humankind is education. Still, technology has not yet delivered on any of its promises for better learning. At Kognity, we have set out to change this. Our vision is to radically improve learning for the world’s school students.

Kognity is the all-in-one, curriculum-aligned teaching and learning platform for Cambridge IGCSE™, the IB Diploma Programme and High School Science. The platform provides interactive textbooks, analytics and assessment support – all in one place. We are experts at combining pedagogy and technology to create comprehensive, engaging, digital-first teaching and learning resources. Kognity saves teachers time, improves learning experiences and empowers students to become independent learners.

It all began with two students who wanted to create the dynamic and interactive learning resources they’d always wanted to experience in their own classrooms. Today, teachers and students in over 1000 schools and over 100 countries rely on Kognity.

✋🏽✋🏿✋🏻 Introducing DEI Roundtables 🌈🚀

As we navigate a rapidly changing world, it's crucial to prioritize diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) in the workplace now more than ever. 

Are you a Stockholm-based company that’s interested in taking your DEI initiatives to the next level? 

We would like to invite 4 to 5 like-minded companies to join us in exploring these topics further through quarterly roundtables. These small group chats will provide us with the opportunity to share best practices, discuss challenges, and explore innovative ways to promote belonging within our respective organizations.

We would love to hear from you if you're interested in participating. Please let us know by commenting or sending us a direct message. Let's learn from one another and work together to create more diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplaces.

What is self-leadership & stress management? Last week, we had the honor to chat with Deborah Mühlrad about the art of listening to your body's signals. 

Deborah shared practical tips and strategies that we can apply in our daily lives to work proactively and prioritize our well-being.

Here are our key takeaways from the session:

1. Physical health: What time you go to bed matters! Research shows that our bodies recover physically between 10 pm - 2 am.
2. Mental Health: Turn off notifications or use flight mode when you need to focus. This will reduce noise and help you stay on task.
3. Emotional health: Plan on how to communicate how you feel. Put words to your feelings and share with others when you need support.

Thank you for an engaging and informative session, Deborah Mühlrad.

🌟 Hispanic & Lantinx Heritage Month 🌟

From September 15 to October 15, we want to shine a spotlight on the culture, history, and contributions of Hispanic and Latinx communities. 🎉

Here are three educators that we would like to recognize this month:

Sylvia Acevedo – a Mexican-American engineer, entrepreneur, and advocate for STEM education. She served as the CEO of the Girl Scouts of the USA and has worked to promote STEM education for girls.

Angela Duckworth – a psychologist of Hispanic descent, known for her research on grit and perseverance in education. Her work has had a significant impact on how educators approach student success.

Pedro Noguera – is a prominent sociologist and educator of Puerto Rican descent. He is known for his work in urban education, social justice, and educational equity. He has authored numerous books and articles on these topics and is a sought-after speaker on educational issues.

During Hispanic & Lantinx Heritage Month, let's take a moment to honor and celebrate remarkable Hispanic educators, who have left an indelible mark on the world of education. Their dedication and contributions continue to inspire us all. 🌟📚🎓

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_author_headline: CEO & Co-Founder at Kognity
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
I'm very humbled and pleased to announce that Steven Zavari is joining the Kognity board.

Steven was until recently Amplify's General Manager of STEM, where he spearheaded the creation, introduction, and expansion of Amplify Science, which under his leadership has become the top-selling and most esteemed K-8 science program across the United States, benefiting over 4 million students. Steven currently leads the development of Amplify's international business. I am absolutely thrilled to have Steven lend his knowledge and insights to Kognity. At the heart of Kognity is impact - both depth of impact and reach of impact - and I know Steven will help us improve learning for millions of students in the US and beyond. 

Very excited to be working together with you Steven!

We had a such a great time connecting with educators at the National Science Teaching Association National Conference in Denver... 🔬 

So many great conversations at the Kognity booth, and lots of fascinating workshops – including one led by our very own Sasha Ferreira! 💡 

We'll be in New Orleans for the next NSTA National Conference in November – see you there? 👋

We're excited to be exhibiting at the ASCD Annual Conference in Washington D.C. this weekend! 🎉 

Stop by our booth to say hi to Sarah Daley and Nick Foladare, and get a live demo of Kognity for High School Science! 🔎 

#ASCD24 #EdLeaders #DistrictLeaders #edtech #edtechinnovation

If you're one of over 1,300 IB educators coming together for the IB Global Conference in Daegu this week, join Matthew Kuykendall for Kognity's break-out session, Boosting Student Achievement Through Peer Feedback.

That's on Friday, March 22 at 3.30pm in Room 321.

And don't forget to stop by booth S3 to catch up with the Kognity team!

#IBGC2024 #edtechinnovation #ibdiploma

Heading to Denver for the National Science Teaching Association National Conference? 🔬 

Don't miss Sasha Ferreira's workshop on Saturday! 📋 

Join us to explore the importance of having students share initial ideas, investigate, sense make, and reflect on their learning journey. 🔎 

And be sure to come and say hi at the Kognity booth! 👋

What are the best ways to bring the sciences to life in the IB classroom? 🔬 

Join us on Thursday, March 14 for "How to Inspire Young Scientists" – a webinar hosted by expert IB educator John Patton. Let's explore innovative instructional techniques that will spark a lasting passion for science in your students.

Register now at: https://lnkd.in/dQE4ryJw

(Can't make it? Sign up anyway and you'll get the recording)

We're so excited to be offering free, in-person professional development for science educators with the Washington Capital Region ESD 113!

Registration is open NOW for our three immersive workshops on March 26:

💡 Student-Centric Mastery: A 3D Approach to NGSS Lessons in Physics – https://lnkd.in/dx7sfBfr

🔬 Ignite Biology Curiosity: Crafting Productive Student Conversations in NGSS – https://lnkd.in/dNqh76Hu

⚛ Classroom Alchemy: Inquiry-Driven NGSS Lessons in Chemistry – https://lnkd.in/dxVYU-FX

Meet our workshop leaders!

Jeff Jorgensen has been teaching at Arroyo High School since 1990. He currently teaches Physics in the Universe and AP Physics 1, and he has been the Science Department Chair for many years. His greatest joy as a teacher is working with his amazing students and collaborating with science colleagues.

Through her teaching and leadership experience inside and out of the classroom, Sasha Ferreira has seen the huge impact working with educational technology can have on students. As Kognity's Senior Curriculum Specialist, Sasha now helps districts and schools provide educators with the tools and resources they need to engage and challenge high school students in their science classrooms.

With 13 years of experience teaching Chemistry, Anjana Iyer is a fervent advocate for inclusive education. Recognized as a New Jersey State Finalist for the 2023 Presidential Award for Excellence in Math and Science Teaching, and winner of the 2022 High School Educator of the Year at Hillsborough High School, NJ, Anjana believes in every student's potential to excel.

👩🏼🤝👩🏻👩🏿🤝👩🏻 Let's take a moment to recognize and appreciate all of our female-identifying colleagues. To every woman on her journey, keep pushing boundaries, chasing dreams, and empowering others along the way. Happy International Women's Day!

#iwd2024 #internationalwomensday #womenintech

The countdown to Engage Uganda is on! 🇺🇬 

Join us at the Aga Khan High School, Kampala on March 22 and 23 for exciting speakers, engaging workshops, and a chance to network with your fellow IB & IGCSE educators.

We’ve invited the International Baccalaureate to participate in this event, and we’re happy to announce that they’ll be hosting a full day of sessions for you on Friday, March 22.

Then on Saturday, March 23, in Kognity’s sessions we'll focus on building confidence with pedagogical methods and practical teaching strategies.

Learn more about the agenda and register for free at https://lnkd.in/dGdVZgds

We are thrilled to introduce two exceptional individuals who have recently joined our Account Management and Content teams at Kognity:

Valentina Tosi - Senior Key Account Manager
Francesca Gallisai - Content Project Coordinator 

Let's give them a warm and enthusiastic welcome!  🌟🎉

John Patton is the IB Coordinator and a teacher of #ibdp Biology and ESS at St Gilgen International School, Austria.

John loves teaching with Kognity because it enables him to spend more classroom time exploring the most exciting aspects of his subject.

Hear more from John on how Kognity helps him to foster his students' passion for learning: https://lnkd.in/d_Ukhqd2

#ibeducation #ibdiploma #edtechinnovation

Cheers, Edlink! ☕ 

We're delighted to be integration partners, and we're looking forward to continuing this collaboration. 🤝

📢 Attention, teachers of IB DP Environmental Systems and Societies! 📢 

It's time to get up to speed with the new #ibdp ESS curriculum.

📋 If you haven't had time to read up on the changes yet, we have just the webinar for you! Check out "Unpacking the new ESS course" for some key takeaways from the update.

🔎 And for more insights into the new syllabus, register for Jennifer Brandsberg-Engelmann's upcoming webinar, "What's changing in IB DP ESS?" on May 21. 

Full details at https://lnkd.in/dYGq8cQU

Not long now until the first IB DP exams of this year... time to get organized! 🗓 

Help your #ibdp students to plan out their exam season and make the most of their independent study time with this customisable planner: https://lnkd.in/dHUQTAsQ

Inquiry-based learning is a transformative instructional approach in the high school science classroom. 💫 

Here are 3 reasons why inquiry-based learning matters:

💪 It empowers students, placing them at the heart of learning experiences.

⚡ It ignites authentic engagement with scientific concepts.

🌊 It has a ripple effect that extends beyond the classroom.

To find out more, check out our white paper: "The Power of Inquiry: Centering Student Experience and Real-Life Application in Science Education".

Download the white paper at https://lnkd.in/d8DVCS4n

#scienceeducation #empowerstudents #edtechinnovation

The results are in, and we're excited to announce that Kognity for High School Science is a double finalist in this year's EdTech Cool Tool Awards! 🏅  

We're honored to be recognized in both the "Curriculum and Instruction Solution" and "Science Solution" categories.  

The EdTech Awards were established by EdTech Digest in 2010 to celebrate the most exceptional innovators, leaders, and trendsetters in education technology. 💡 

These awards are judged based on criteria including pedagogical workability, efficacy and results, support, clarity, value and potential.

#edtech #edtechinnovation #scienceeducation

Happy solar eclipse day! 🌑 

Feeling inspired to dive deeper into the wonders of the solar system? Check out Kognity's new curriculum for high school Earth and Space Science – coming soon, ready for the school year 2024-2025. 🚀 

Unlock a preview lesson and a summative assessment now at https://lnkd.in/d3j8cPzs

#UnlockTheUniverse #solareclipse #eclipse

At our second roundtable meeting, we took the opportunity to dive into how we measure and track the various initiatives for diversity, inclusion, belonging, and equity (DIBE) in our organizations.

We were happy to see the return of Kelly Lawson Pihl, Senior Manager of Employee Engagement at Bolt; Malin R., HR Manager at Chief Rebel; and Rosanna Viitasalo, Talent Manager at BookBeat. 🤝 🌈

Big thanks also to Sarah Daley and Sasha Ferreira for representing Kognity. We're excited to apply what we've learned to further improve our DIBE efforts.

Here are three key takeaways from a valuable discussion. Can't wait for the next one! 🙌

We’re proud to announce that Kognity for High School Science has reached the finals of the 2024 SIIA CODiE Awards in the "Best Science Instructional Solution for Grades 9-12" category.

This premier awards program for the software and information industries is produced by the Software & Information Industry Association (SIIA), the principal trade association for the software, education, media and digital content industries.

Finalists are determined by industry experts, and Kognity was selected among hundreds of nominations.

We’re looking forward to the virtual ceremony on May 21, when the winners of this year’s #CODIEAwards will be announced!

We're so grateful to everyone who took part in our recent Engage Uganda conference in Kampala. 🇺🇬

What an amazing two days of learning and making connections, with over 110 delegates joining us from 6 different countries! 🤝 

Special thanks to the International Baccalaureate for participating in this event, to the hosts of all of the fantastic workshops, and to the Aga Khan High School, Kampala for hosting the conference. 🌟

Kognity featured on National Ugandan TV channel NTV Uganda after our latest Educational conference Kognity Engage that we hosted in Kampala. It includes an interview with our very own Marcus T. - check it out here https://lnkd.in/dRdFq_T4

Preparing to deliver the new IB DP Environmental Systems and Societies course for the first time this September? 🎓 

You won't want to miss our next webinar, “IB DP ESS: Unpacking Assessment”, on Thursday, May 2 at 4pm UTC. 📝 

Experienced IB educator Hannington Ogutu will lead this deep dive into the key components of assessment in the new #ibdp ESS course – including assessment objectives, criteria and methodologies.

Register now at https://lnkd.in/dwDN3TJb

Can’t make it? Sign up anyway, and you'll receive a recording of the session. 📽
As we continue on our mission to radically improve learning, we're very proud to be recognized in TIME's list of the world's top EdTech companies of 2024. 🚀

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
🎧 Episode #139 of the SaaSiest Podcast is here!

In this episode, we speak with Helena Tivell, VP of People, Kognity, the all-in-one digital teaching and learning platform – with interactive content, analytics, and assessment support.

We talked with Helana about the importance of continuously developing the leaders of your organization. In particular, we looked into some of the methods she uses to develop and upskill her leaders and why it matters:

– What is the responsibility of a VP of People role?
– How do you further develop and enhance leaders’ ability to lead?
– What tools and methods are used to support this process?
– How do you decide on which areas to focus the upskilling in?
– How do you ensure the learnings live past the training sessions?

These are some of the many questions we address with Helena. Please tune in to learn what steps she’s taken to continuously support the leadership team with an upskilling process.

Listen to the full episode here: https://lnkd.in/dXYATZyb

Tech Days at Kognity were an absolute blast! 

3 days of insightful sessions and fun activities that brought our remote team closer together. Some highlights:

🌎 Meeting the broader team: Finally got to meet so many colleagues in person. We’re spread across different cities, so it was amazing to connect face-to-face.

📝 Learning moment: Casually mentioned a Git challenge during lunch, and a colleague helped me tackle it right then and there. Visual explanations on the drawing board made all the difference!

🏓 Ping pong tournament, breakfasts & a fancy dinner: A great way to break the ice and bond.

🗣 Diverse conversations: Lunches turned into discussions on everything from 3D printing & off-shore wind turbine  maintenance to tracking healthy sleep cycles! So much to learn from such a diverse group.

⭐ Global representation: During a session, I looked around and felt proud—colleagues from Brazil, Hungary, Sweden, Lebanon, Ukraine, and beyond. 
 Being from Pakistan and working in Sweden, I love how the company truly embodies diversity.

It was more than just work—it was also about connection, learning, and celebrating our unique Kognity culture. 
Here’s to more events like this! 🙌

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_author_headline: 1 in 3 IB DP Schools Use Kognity, let’s meet and see why
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
“Today’s presentation was excellent! I found I only use 20% of Kognity's potential, but even with that 20% it has already made a significant impact on my students’ results!” 

We recently had the absolute pleasure of hosting 🇮🇩 Engage Indonesia 🇮🇩  at The Singapore School Pantai Indah Kapuk in Jakarta. What a treat it was to brush shoulders with passionate and likeminded educators. The entire day was buzzing with excitement and was as impactful as it was humid.

What did we learn?
💙 We have users who are passionate about Kognity and know how to show it. I can only assume this is directly connected to the relationships 
Kim Sofie Møller Warmedal and Richard Morgan have built with schools in the region. 

🤖 Per Wising’s session on AI in particular made space for these educators to initiate a powerful conversations on how AI should be utilized in the classroom and we were all better for it. 

🙋♂️ During my enablement session, I was able to display quick and digestible strategies for how to increase student engagement with Kognity. Big shout out to Theo Trotzig for helping to answer questions during this session. His technical answers really helped the session come alive. 


🤝Another big thank you to Daniel Bayram Vasquez V. for speaking to nearly every attendee over the day and initiating valuable conversations we would have not been able to have otherwise.

🥳 None of this would have been possible without the dedication and hard work from Katilina Gaffney It was amazing to see how Kati maximized the days potential with truly brilliant sessions, including giving time during the start of the event for a leaders lunch. We used this time to discuss a growth mindset in education and how to take actionable steps toward implementing this mindset. 

💃 🎙️ As the day came to a close, we all enjoyed drinks, dinner and a few karaoke tunes from our very own Charlotte (Lottie) Trimmer Trimmer.

All in all, it was an extremely successful Engage event and memorable experience for everyone who attended. 

🙏 P.S. thank you to everyone else who made this event possible including our amazing Kognity community who attended. It’s our vision to impact the world’s students and we could not have done this without you. Thank you!

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
👨🚀 Kognity at PyCon Sweden 👩🚀 

Highlights: 

⭐ Marcus Näslund explored 'GOTO' statement in ancient game code to modern implementations, it was a reminder to stay curious and explore how things work under the hood. 
Wondering how a certain game works? Google it. There might be an open source version out there! 😉  

⭐ Got inspired by Saaya Sorrells-Weatherford’s talk on advocating for women and immigrants in tech.

⭐ Tobias Modig's message about avoiding burnout and building solid learning foundations hit home. Sometimes, slowing down makes us better programmers in the long run.

⭐ 🌌 Dr. Cristián Maureira-Fredes’s dive into CPython and the low-level possibilities it unlocks. Ever thought of creating your own Python using a different alphabet? It's possible—and he showed us how with Swedish! 

Networking: 
⭐ Shared ideas with Javier de la Puente Alonso on deploying Flask apps using JuJu on Google Cloud. 
⭐ Connected with incredible minds like Anastasiia Potekhina and Beatriz Uezu from PyLadies Stockholm, and Saad Hasan - the AI and database wiz. 

Workshops I loved:
⭐ Schneider Electric (Kamil Kulig & Adam Brzyzek): Hands-on setting up a MongoDB (NoSQL) database and CRUD operations.
⭐ Lyst: Using Gen AI to tag themes in customer reviews. Practical, innovative, and game-changing!
⭐ 46elks: Chat with AI over SMS. Set up a live chatbot in real-time—great for experimenting with AI-driven SMS solutions.

Why Attend Events Like PyCon❓ 
Meeting people, sharing ideas, and seeing what others are building is incredibly motivating. If you’ve ever thought about attending a conference like this—do it. You’ll leave with new skills, a stronger network, and a deeper love for the field. 

It was my first. Can’t wait for the next one.

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_author_headline: 2023 MSTA Science Teacher of the Year
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
Four takeaways and three important verbs... my reflections from the NSTA national conference

Last month, a group from Kognity had the opportunity to attend the National Science Teaching Association's annual conference in New Orleans, Louisiana. It was so nice to meet up in person, as we all work from all over the globe. We had many takeaways, but these are the ones that stuck out the most to me.

🧲 Physics: There is a strong need for support among teachers without a Physics background. We also heard more about the  shift toward more conceptual teaching approaches and a growing popularity of using whiteboards, as studies show they increase student engagement and note-taking.

🗺️ Integration of cultural references: We need to continue to make instruction and assessment more culturally relevant by emphasizing the importance of leveraging students' cultural backgrounds to enhance engagement and advance equity.

🦾 AI in Education: Teachers are keen to incorporate AI into their teaching and stay ahead of educational trends. We want students to know how to use AI efficiently and effectively so they can use it post graduation in a way that works for them.

💚 The Kognity approach: Our approach to listening and being open to feedback and improvements is seen as a real strength.

We also did some thinking around how to continue to improve after our reflections:
？ How can we provide teachers with practical support and resources for AI integration?
？ How can we make our content more culturally relevant?
？ How could we encourage the use of whiteboards to promote student engagement and participation?

What’s next?
Wayne Wright, Tessa Dagley, and I held a session that was focused around 3 verbs: Listen, Reflect, Improve. I invite anyone who has read all the way here to take 5 minutes to dive into one of these three verbs. Feel free to choose something that is in your professional or personal life! What we realized is that TIME is the biggest factor in not being able to perform these verbs, which is why I am giving you a reminder today. 😄

#NSTAFall24 #Science #Education #STEM #STEMEd

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_author_headline: 1 in 3 IB DP Schools Use Kognity, let’s meet and see why
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
“Today’s presentation was excellent! I found I only use 20% of Kognity's potential, but even with that 20% it has already made a significant impact on my students’ results!” 

We recently had the absolute pleasure of hosting 🇮🇩 Engage Indonesia 🇮🇩  at The Singapore School Pantai Indah Kapuk in Jakarta. What a treat it was to brush shoulders with passionate and likeminded educators. The entire day was buzzing with excitement and was as impactful as it was humid.

What did we learn?
💙 We have users who are passionate about Kognity and know how to show it. I can only assume this is directly connected to the relationships 
Kim Sofie Møller Warmedal and Richard Morgan have built with schools in the region. 

🤖 Per Wising’s session on AI in particular made space for these educators to initiate a powerful conversations on how AI should be utilized in the classroom and we were all better for it. 

🙋♂️ During my enablement session, I was able to display quick and digestible strategies for how to increase student engagement with Kognity. Big shout out to Theo Trotzig for helping to answer questions during this session. His technical answers really helped the session come alive. 


🤝Another big thank you to Daniel Bayram Vasquez V. for speaking to nearly every attendee over the day and initiating valuable conversations we would have not been able to have otherwise.

🥳 None of this would have been possible without the dedication and hard work from Katilina Gaffney It was amazing to see how Kati maximized the days potential with truly brilliant sessions, including giving time during the start of the event for a leaders lunch. We used this time to discuss a growth mindset in education and how to take actionable steps toward implementing this mindset. 

💃 🎙️ As the day came to a close, we all enjoyed drinks, dinner and a few karaoke tunes from our very own Charlotte (Lottie) Trimmer Trimmer.

All in all, it was an extremely successful Engage event and memorable experience for everyone who attended. 

🙏 P.S. thank you to everyone else who made this event possible including our amazing Kognity community who attended. It’s our vision to impact the world’s students and we could not have done this without you. Thank you!

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
👨🚀 Kognity at PyCon Sweden 👩🚀 

Highlights: 

⭐ Marcus Näslund explored 'GOTO' statement in ancient game code to modern implementations, it was a reminder to stay curious and explore how things work under the hood. 
Wondering how a certain game works? Google it. There might be an open source version out there! 😉  

⭐ Got inspired by Saaya Sorrells-Weatherford’s talk on advocating for women and immigrants in tech.

⭐ Tobias Modig's message about avoiding burnout and building solid learning foundations hit home. Sometimes, slowing down makes us better programmers in the long run.

⭐ 🌌 Dr. Cristián Maureira-Fredes’s dive into CPython and the low-level possibilities it unlocks. Ever thought of creating your own Python using a different alphabet? It's possible—and he showed us how with Swedish! 

Networking: 
⭐ Shared ideas with Javier de la Puente Alonso on deploying Flask apps using JuJu on Google Cloud. 
⭐ Connected with incredible minds like Anastasiia Potekhina and Beatriz Uezu from PyLadies Stockholm, and Saad Hasan - the AI and database wiz. 

Workshops I loved:
⭐ Schneider Electric (Kamil Kulig & Adam Brzyzek): Hands-on setting up a MongoDB (NoSQL) database and CRUD operations.
⭐ Lyst: Using Gen AI to tag themes in customer reviews. Practical, innovative, and game-changing!
⭐ 46elks: Chat with AI over SMS. Set up a live chatbot in real-time—great for experimenting with AI-driven SMS solutions.

Why Attend Events Like PyCon❓ 
Meeting people, sharing ideas, and seeing what others are building is incredibly motivating. If you’ve ever thought about attending a conference like this—do it. You’ll leave with new skills, a stronger network, and a deeper love for the field. 

It was my first. Can’t wait for the next one.

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_author_headline: 2023 MSTA Science Teacher of the Year
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
Four takeaways and three important verbs... my reflections from the NSTA national conference

Last month, a group from Kognity had the opportunity to attend the National Science Teaching Association's annual conference in New Orleans, Louisiana. It was so nice to meet up in person, as we all work from all over the globe. We had many takeaways, but these are the ones that stuck out the most to me.

🧲 Physics: There is a strong need for support among teachers without a Physics background. We also heard more about the  shift toward more conceptual teaching approaches and a growing popularity of using whiteboards, as studies show they increase student engagement and note-taking.

🗺️ Integration of cultural references: We need to continue to make instruction and assessment more culturally relevant by emphasizing the importance of leveraging students' cultural backgrounds to enhance engagement and advance equity.

🦾 AI in Education: Teachers are keen to incorporate AI into their teaching and stay ahead of educational trends. We want students to know how to use AI efficiently and effectively so they can use it post graduation in a way that works for them.

💚 The Kognity approach: Our approach to listening and being open to feedback and improvements is seen as a real strength.

We also did some thinking around how to continue to improve after our reflections:
？ How can we provide teachers with practical support and resources for AI integration?
？ How can we make our content more culturally relevant?
？ How could we encourage the use of whiteboards to promote student engagement and participation?

What’s next?
Wayne Wright, Tessa Dagley, and I held a session that was focused around 3 verbs: Listen, Reflect, Improve. I invite anyone who has read all the way here to take 5 minutes to dive into one of these three verbs. Feel free to choose something that is in your professional or personal life! What we realized is that TIME is the biggest factor in not being able to perform these verbs, which is why I am giving you a reminder today. 😄

#NSTAFall24 #Science #Education #STEM #STEMEd

🚫 Debunking the Myth: Using a Digital Curriculum Means Teaching Fully Online

For many teachers, the idea of adopting a digital curriculum raises concerns about losing the hands-on, interactive aspects of in-person teaching, especially in subjects like science, where inquiry and experimentation are vital.

But here’s the good news: a digital curriculum isn’t about replacing your teaching style. Instead, it’s about enhancing it. 💡

At Kognity, we believe in empowering educators with tools that support blended learning, where digital resources complement in-person instruction. Whether it’s extending learning beyond the classroom, providing instant feedback, or offering data-driven insights, a digital curriculum is designed to work with you, not against you.

Our latest blog breaks down how:
🔬 NGSS-aligned digital curricula enrich hands-on, inquiry-based learning.
🎯 Flexible tools can adapt to traditional, flipped, or hybrid classrooms.
📊 Analytics help you track progress and personalize support for every student.

Ready to see how digital tools can empower your teaching, not replace it? Check out the blog: https://lnkd.in/djEP-xGs

🎓 Transforming Math Education: Academic Studies Prove Kognity’s Impact

At Kognity, we're proud to be making a measurable difference to student learning. Two recent academic studies conducted in Shanghai have validated what we've always believed: Kognity empowers students to achieve more.

✨ Study 1: Effectiveness of Digital Textbook (Kognity) on the Performance in Calculus of Grade 12 Students in Shanghai China

The study showed that Grade 12 IB DP Mathematics students using Kognity significantly outperformed their peers in calculus, with more students achieving top grades (6 and 7).

📢 "When it comes to unleashing academic potential, few tools are as captivating as Kognity's digital textbook—particularly when examining its impact on calculus performance." — Agrix N. Go, et al. (2025), Central Luzon State University.

✨ Study 2: Effectiveness of Digital Textbook (Kognity) on The Mathematical Thinking Skills of Grade 12 Students in Shanghai China

Students using Kognity for IB DP Mathematics demonstrated remarkable growth in skills like problem-solving, induction, and modeling, with 100% achieving Grades 6 or higher.

📢 "The use of Kognity as a digital textbook has been efficient in supporting and improving the students’ mathematical thinking skills in various fields." — Agrix N. Go,  et al. (2025), Central Luzon State University.

🔍 What These Studies Tell Us
✅ Kognity significantly improves understanding, retention, and performance in Mathematics.
✅ Interactive digital tools engage students more effectively than traditional methods.
✅ By integrating Kognity, educators can amplify classroom learning outcomes.

📖 Learn More
These groundbreaking studies were conducted by researchers at Central Luzon State University, and authored by Agrix N. Go, et al. (2025). You can read the full articles here:

👉 https://lnkd.in/dJfghgzx
👉 https://lnkd.in/dnh2Qh3a

These results underscore the transformative power of digital teaching and learning materials. As the world embraces technology in the classroom, Kognity is helping teachers and students achieve their goals with tools that truly make an impact.

Ready to see how Kognity can elevate your teaching? Let’s connect and transform education together. 🌟

Both studies were published by the International Journal of Research and Innovation in Social Science (IJRISS)

Our CEO and Co-founder’s visit to Nigeria with the Official Swedish Delegation highlights just how far-reaching Kognity’s mission is — empowering students and educators through high-quality, accessible education.

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_author_headline: CEO & Co-Founder at Kognity
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
Honored to have joined the Official Swedish Delegation to Nigeria this week, alongside HRH Crown Princess Victoria, Swedish Minister of Infrastructure and Housing Andreas Carlsson, and prominent business leaders from the Swedish private sector. 

During the visit, I got the opportunity to present on Kognity’s decade-long impact throughout Africa, and our plans for the future. I loved meeting many inspiring up-and-coming Nigerian entrepreneurs, visiting Impact Hub Lagos, and having insightful dialogues about the role of education in societal development with both business and governmental leaders from both countries.

I also visited one of our longstanding customer schools, American International School of Lagos witnessing first hand the excellent work they are doing. And best part of the trip, I got to meet with a bunch of happy Kognity using students! A great few days to reaffirm our commitment to improving education for as many as possible, in Africa and beyond.

📚 What does it take to run two diploma programs under one roof?

In this episode, IB educator Richard Jones-Nerzic shares how Ecole Moser in Switzerland integrates the IB Diploma and the Swiss Maturité into a single, demanding program. He reflects on the cultural, curricular, and pedagogical balancing act required—and what other schools can learn from it.

In this episode, we explore:

🔸 Balancing traditional and progressive pedagogy in the same classroom
🔸 How TOK, critical thinking, and subject skills bridge both diplomas
🔸 The impact on workload, mindset, and mission
🔸 Simple wins and tips for educators working with mixed curricula

Whether you're managing dual programs or just curious about what’s possible, this episode offers rare insights into international education in action.
